intro: Antidesma montanum var. microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited antidesma, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by tiny, spherical fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
